Class Order

java.lang.Object
com.group18.model.Order
public class Order extends Object
Represents an order in a transactional system. This class contains information about the order's identification, associated cashier, order date, total price, status, and the list of items included in the order. It also provides methods to manage the items in the order and calculate the total price dynamically.

  • Field Details

    • orderId

      private int orderId
      A unique identifier for the order. This ID serves as a primary key to distinguish each order within the system.

    • cashierId

      private int cashierId
      Represents the unique identifier of the cashier associated with the order. This identifier is used to track which cashier executed or handled the order in the system.

    • orderDate

      private LocalDateTime orderDate
      Represents the date and time when the order was created. This field is used to track when the order was placed in the transactional system.

    • totalPrice

      private BigDecimal totalPrice
      Represents the total price of all items in the order. This variable is dynamically updated based on the current list of items in the order. It is calculated as the sum of the prices of all items included in the order.

    • orderItems

      private List<OrderItem> orderItems
      Represents the list of items included in the order. Each item in the list is represented by an instance of the OrderItem class. This list is used to manage all the order's items dynamically and calculate the total price of the order based on the associated items.

    • status

      private String status
      Represents the current status of the order. Possible values include "PENDING", "COMPLETED", "CANCELLED", or other custom-defined statuses depending on the business logic. Default value is "PENDING".

    • refundedAmount

      private BigDecimal refundedAmount
      Represents the total amount that has been refunded for the order. This value is initialized to zero and is updated whenever a refund is processed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructs a new Order instance with default values. Initializes an empty list of order items, sets the order date to the current date and time, and initializes the total price to zero.

  • Method Details

    • getRefundedAmount

      public BigDecimal getRefundedAmount()
      Retrieves the total refunded amount for the order.
      Returns:
      the refunded amount as a BigDecimal

    • setRefundedAmount

      public void setRefundedAmount(BigDecimal refundedAmount)
      Sets the refunded amount for the order.
      Parameters:
      refundedAmount - the amount to set as refunded, represented as a BigDecimal

      public int getOrderId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the order.
      Returns:
      the order ID as an integer.

    • setOrderId

      Sets the unique identifier for this order.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier to assign to the order.

    • getCashierId

      public int getCashierId()
      Retrieves the identifier of the cashier associated with this order.
      Returns:
      the cashier ID as an integer.

    • setCashierId

      public void setCashierId(int cashierId)
      Sets the identifier of the cashier associated with the order.
      Parameters:
      cashierId - the unique identifier of the cashier to be assigned to the order

    • getOrderDate

      public LocalDateTime getOrderDate()
      Retrieves the date and time when the order was created.
      Returns:
      the order creation date and time as a LocalDateTime.

    • setOrderDate

      public void setOrderDate(LocalDateTime orderDate)
      Sets the date and time when the order was placed. This value is used to record the specific moment an order is created or updated.
      Parameters:
      orderDate - the date and time of the order as a LocalDateTime object

    • getTotalPrice

      public BigDecimal getTotalPrice()
      Retrieves the total price of the order.
      Returns:
      The total price as a BigDecimal.

    • setTotalPrice

      public void setTotalPrice(BigDecimal totalPrice)
      Sets the total price of the order.
      Parameters:
      totalPrice - the total price to be set for the order as a BigDecimal

    • getOrderItems

      public List<OrderItem> getOrderItems()
      Retrieves the list of items associated with the order.
      Returns:
      a list of OrderItem objects representing the items in the order.

    • setOrderItems

      public void setOrderItems(List<OrderItem> orderItems)
      Sets the list of items included in the order.
      Parameters:
      orderItems - the list of OrderItem representing the items in the order

    • addOrderItem

      public void addOrderItem(OrderItem item)
      Adds an OrderItem to the list of order items and updates the total price of the order.
      Parameters:
      item - the OrderItem to be added to the order

    • removeOrderItem

      public void removeOrderItem(OrderItem item)
      Removes the specified order item from the list of items in the order and updates the total price of the order.
      Parameters:
      item - the order item to be removed from the order

    • updateTotalPrice

      private void updateTotalPrice()
      Recalculates and updates the total price of the order based on the prices of all the items currently in the order. The total price is computed by summing up the prices of all `OrderItem` objects in the `orderItems` list. If the list is empty, the total price is set to zero.

    • getStatus

      public String getStatus()
      Retrieves the current status of the order.
      Returns:
      the status of the order as a String. The status indicates the current state of the order (e.g., "PENDING", "REJECTED", "PROCESSED_FULL").

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(String status)
      Sets the status of the order.
      Parameters:
      status - The new status to be assigned to the order.
